title: Four teams boast six players each for Pro Bowl
content: The Ravens, Broncos, 49ers and Seahawks each led the way with six players each selected for the Pro Bowl Games, announced Tuesday.

title: Sources: NBA eyes new ways to combat tanking
content: The NBA has begun to gather input from its owners and GMs on new ways to combat tanking, sources told ESPN.

title: Vikes' McCarthy out with hairline fracture in hand
content: Vikings quarterback J.J. McCarthy has a "very small" hairline fracture in his right hand and will be sidelined for Thursday's Christmas Day game against the Lions, coach Kevin O'Connell said Tuesday.

title: Top-5 recruit Robinson picks Staley's Gamecocks
content: Jerzy Robinson, the No. 5-ranked player in the girls' SportsCenter NEXT 100 class of 2026, has committed to Dawn Staley's South Carolina Gamecocks, she announced Tuesday.

title: Rozier lawyers move to dismiss betting charges
content: Terry Rozier attorneys say the government overstepped when it accused his client of wire fraud stemming from his alleged involvement in a sports betting scheme and is asking a federal judge to dismiss the charges.

title: Sources: Pirates, O'Hearn agree to 2-year deal
content: First baseman Ryan O'Hearn, who earned his first All-Star selection last season, has reached a two-year, $29M deal with the Pirates, sources told ESPN.

title: New suit challenges transfer portal damages
content: Former Georgia pass rusher Damon Wilson II says the school's athletic department is attempting to illegally punish him for entering the transfer portal in a lawsuit filed Tuesday.

content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Two dates, three traps: How to fix your NPS, PAN and ITR before December 31
content: December brings crucial financial deadlines. Ensure your NPS Scheme A is switched by the 25th to avoid unwanted changes. The 31st marks the final chance for belated or revised tax returns, crucial for carrying forward losses. Also, verify Aadhaar-PAN compliance for specific PAN holders to prevent inoperability. These actions prevent future financial headaches.

title: YouTuber under ED lens flew over 130 guests for Dubai for his cruise wedding
content: A UP-based YouTube influencer, Anurag Dwivedi, facing ED money-laundering probes for alleged ties to illegal betting, reportedly spent crores on a lavish Dubai destination wedding for over 130 guests. The lavish affair aboard a cruise ship, including flights and luxury stays, has drawn significant official scrutiny. The ED has seized assets worth an estimated Rs 20 crore.

title: IND vs NZ: No Williamson! New Zealand announce squads for India series
content: New Zealand have named ODI and T20I squads for their India tour, using the series to prepare for the 2026 T20 World Cup. Mitchell Santner will captain the T20Is, with Michael Bracewell leading the ODIs. Several senior players return, young talents earn call-ups, and some stars are rested to manage workloads.

title: Tribal pushback over 'illegal settlers' kills 2 in Assam's West Karbi Anglong
content: Two people died and dozens of police officers were injured in violent tribal protests in Assam's West Karbi Anglong district. Demonstrators, armed with bows and crude bombs, clashed with security forces over alleged illegal non-tribal settlements on protected lands. Internet services were suspended as authorities vowed legal action against those involved.

title: 'If you are serious‚Ä¶‚Äô: Warner Brothers‚Äô 5th largest shareholder to Paramount
content: Paramount's bid for Warner Bros. Discovery received a boost with Larry Ellison's $40.4 billion guarantee, but a major shareholder believes a higher premium is needed. While some investors see Ellison's backing as stabilizing, the WBD board still recommends Netflix, citing misleading information. Investors now have until January 21 to decide.

title: Madhya Pradesh electoral rolls cut by over 42.7 lakh after SIR, 8.4 lakh voters 'unmapped'
content: Madhya Pradesh has removed 42.7 lakh voters, 7.4% of its electorate, in a massive electoral roll clean-up. This extensive revision, involving door-to-door verification, aimed to ensure accuracy by deleting deceased, shifted, and duplicate entries. The process also identified 'unmapped' voters requiring further documentation.

title: 'USS Defiant': Can 'Trump-class' warships deter China or just drain Pentagon?
content: President Trump unveiled plans for "Trump-class" warships, colossal missile-heavy vessels intended to form a "Golden Fleet" for the US Navy.  These massive ships aim to counter China's growing naval power and revive American shipbuilding. However, the ambitious project faces significant challenges including industrial capacity issues and questions about the relevance of such large vessels in modern warfare.

title: Fake suicide video, mentions of Trump: Largest set of Epstein documents released; new revelations
content: The DOJ released nearly 30,000 pages of Jeffrey Epstein files, including FBI interviews, victim accounts, Ghislaine Maxwell emails, and flight records involving Donald Trump. The documents detail Epstein‚Äôs abuse, grooming practices, and victims‚Äô trauma, while alleging Maxwell‚Äôs lack of remorse. They also include an alleged fake suicide video and a letter to Larry Nassar referencing Trump. Epstein‚Äôs 2008 plea deal and 2019 death are also highlighted in the files.

title: Salesforce reboots AI strategy: Model errors raise concerns
content: Salesforce is scaling back its reliance on large language models due to reliability issues, shifting focus to more predictable automation. Executives admit a decline in AI model trust, citing instances where agents missed instructions or lost focus. This move follows significant staff reductions attributed to AI deployment, as the company navigates the gap between AI hype and practical business needs.

title: 'Finish him off': How UP bizman was killed, chopped, dumped by wife & lover; cops trace body parts
content: A Sambhal shoe trader was allegedly murdered, dismembered, and dumped by his wife and her lover after being caught in a compromising position. The wife confessed to the crime, detailing how they used an iron rod and shoe-hammer to kill him before dismembering the body and disposing of the parts.

title: Leaving for airport: How to track flights on iPhone and Mac; no third-party apps needed
content: Picking up loved ones from the airport just got easier with Apple's built-in flight tracking. Whether through Messages or Spotlight search on your iPhone or Mac, you can instantly access real-time flight status, including delays and gate information. Simply type or tap a flight number, ensuring you include the airline name for accuracy.

title: India-NZ deal to boost payment interoperability
content: India and New Zealand have agreed to collaborate on domestic payments interoperability and real-time cross-border remittances through integrated Fast Payment Systems. This pact strengthens India's digital payments ecosystem and fintech sector, while also enhancing FDI limits in banking and insurance for Indian financial service providers looking to expand into New Zealand.

title: 'Why do you object when India targets you': Pakistan cleric slams Munir's army‚Äî watch
content: JUI-F chief Maulana Fazlur Rehman stated Pakistan should not oppose Indian attacks if it attacks Afghanistan, questioning the double standard. He emphasized dialogue and political engagement as solutions to regional instability and asserted that political power belongs to the people, not the army..

title: Gabrielle Union opens up on surrogacy shame and desire to be pregnant publicly
content: Dwyane Wade, the NBA legend, and his wife, Gabrielle Union, went through a series of miscarriages as the popular actress tried to get pregnant. Nothing was working out for the couple at one point and Gabrielle Union opened up about how she felt for not being able to carry a child publicly.

title: Paul Rudd reacts to Travis Kelce‚Äôs apology after Chiefs‚Äô playoff exit
content: Actor Paul Rudd shared his perspective on the Kansas City Chiefs' season. He highlighted the joy and memories the team has provided his family. Rudd embraced the team's elimination from playoff contention. He wished Patrick Mahomes a speedy recovery. Rudd also humorously suggested players deserved a break after a long season. He stated he was not too upset.

title: Who is Brittani? Inside Aaron Rodgers‚Äô wife as marriage mystery deepens
content: Steelers quarterback Aaron Rodgers has found unexpected peace in his marriage to Brittani.  Unlike his previous public relationships, Brittani values privacy.  Rodgers credits his wife with providing unconditional love and stability.  This new chapter sees a calmer, more focused Rodgers as he navigates his final NFL years.  His teammates and coaches notice the positive change.

title: Shane McMahon and Marissa Mazzola‚Äôs combined net worth in 2025
content: Shane and Marissa Mazzola-McMahon possess a combined net worth of $650 million, largely attributed to Shane's decades with WWE and his diversified business ventures. While Shane's wealth stems from his executive roles, on-camera presence, and equity in WWE, Marissa's career in film production and PR augments their family fortune.

title: Rohit returns to domestic cricket: Is Jaipur ready? VHT set to get underway
content: Jaipur will witness rare domestic cricket buzz as the Vijay Hazare Trophy 2025‚Äì26 begins with Elite Group C matches at the SMS Stadium. Mumbai‚Äôs opener will feature Rohit Sharma, drawing big crowds. Following the BCCI mandate, his participation has boosted interest, prompting the Rajasthan Cricket Association to strengthen security and improve stadium facilities for fans.

title: Epstein files: Trump's name appears in latest file drop; listed as passenger on 8 private jet flights
content: Newly released DOJ records include an internal email stating that Donald Trump was listed as a passenger on at least eight flights aboard Jeffrey Epstein‚Äôs private jet between 1993 and 1996. The email, written by an assistant US attorney, details occasions when Ghislaine Maxwell and members of Trump‚Äôs family were also listed as passengers, while noting specific flights involving Epstein and potential witnesses. The disclosure is part of a broader release of thousands of Epstein-related documents.

title: Throwback: When Dhoni began his Indian cricket journey ‚Äî with a golden duck
content: MS Dhoni made his international debut on this day in 2004 against Bangladesh, beginning a journey that would transform Indian cricket. Though run out for a duck on debut, his calm, skill and resilience stood out. A match-winning 148 against Pakistan soon followed, launching a legendary career built on leadership, trophies and unmatched composure.

title: From ‚Äògreat friend Modi‚Äô to 50% tariffs: Decoding India‚ÄìUS ties in the Trump era
content: India-US relations are currently characterized by unpredictable fluctuations, driven by transactional politics and personal ego, particularly under President Trump's administration. Despite past bonhomie, trade wars and differing stances on global conflicts have strained ties, creating a complex dynamic between strategic imperatives and political unease.

title: Are chia seeds more effective for weight loss in water or in milk
content: Chia seeds, a kitchen staple, offer varied weight management benefits depending on preparation. Soaked in water, they aid appetite control with minimal calories. Mixed with milk, they become a more substantial, nutrient-rich meal replacement. Understanding these differences helps tailor chia seed consumption for individual weight loss goals, impacting digestion and energy levels.

title: Ilia Topuria divorce: Giorgina Uzcategui‚Äôs allegation that led to police involvement
content: Ilia Topuria‚Äôs ex-wife Giorgina Uzcategui filed a police complaint in Madrid on December 22 over alleged online threats linked to their divorce. Her legal team stressed the case is private and involves a child. No charges have been announced, and both sides remain cautious as legal proceedings continue behind closed doors.

title: 'Every man's life ends the same way...': Quote of the day by Ernest Hemingway
content: Ernest Hemingway was one of the most popular authors of  war and life's struggles fueled timeless novels like 'The Old Man and the Sea,' celebrated for its profound wisdom. Hemingway's 'iceberg theory' influenced generations, emphasizing understated emotion and the enduring significance of how one lives, not just the inevitable end.

title: Michael Jordan net worth in 2025: NBA legend‚Äôs earnings, investments, and wealth
content: Michael Jordan's net worth is estimated at $3.8 billion as of 2025. A significant portion of that wealth was earned throughout his NBA career of over 15 seasons and major brand partnerships like Nike. His sale of the Charlotte Hornets for $3 billion in 2023 was a major financial boost, glorifying his status as one of the wealthiest athletes in the world.

title: VHT: Will Bumrah play in Vijay Hazare Trophy? Updates on Axar Patel too
content: The BCCI has exempted Jasprit Bumrah from the Vijay Hazare Trophy to manage his workload ahead of a busy white-ball season and the T20 World Cup. Despite asking other stars to play domestic cricket, Bumrah has been rested due to past injury concerns. Axar Patel and Ravindra Jadeja will feature in the tournament.

title: 'Taken where?': Last moments of Hindu man lynched in B‚Äôdesh; how rumours cost family its breadwinner
content: A Hindu garment factory worker in Bangladesh was brutally lynched by a mob of around 140 people, allegedly for a blasphemous social media post. Investigators have found no evidence to support the accusation, yet the victim's family lives in fear. Twelve arrests have been made as authorities investigate the deliberate circulation of misinformation.

title: Merry Christmas 2025: Best messages, quotes, wishes and images to share on Christmas
content: Christmas is approaching. Families and friends will connect over food and company. The article offers messages, quotes, and images for sharing. These festive greetings aim to spread joy and warmth. They include wishes for a delightful holiday season. Famous quotes on Christmas are also provided. These offer timeless reflections on the spirit of Christmas.

title: EC's SIR sweep: Nearly 43 lakh voters removed in Madhya Pradesh; Kerala sees over 24 lakh deletions
content: The Election Commission has released draft voter lists for Madhya Pradesh and Kerala, showing significant deletions. Madhya Pradesh removed over 42 lakh voters, including deceased, untraceable, and shifted residents. Kerala also deleted more than 24 lakh names for similar reasons, with final rolls to be published in February.

title: Meet ‚ÄòSuper Mario‚Äô: The man living on cruise ships for 25 years with no home on land
content: Financial advisor Mario Salcedo has lived on cruise ships for 25 years, embracing a life without a fixed address.  He works remotely, managing client portfolios while enjoying the structure and constant motion.  Despite a health condition exacerbated by land, his unique lifestyle offers him a sense of home and predictability, challenging conventional notions of belonging.

title: PM Modi mourns Vinod Kumar Shukla; veteran Hindi writer dies at 89
content: Renowned Hindi writer and Jnanpith laureate Vinod Kumar Shukla passed away at 89. Celebrated for his simple yet profound style, Shukla's novels and poetry, including 'Deewar Mein Ek Khirkee Rehti Thi', deeply influenced modern Hindi literature. His unique narrative, blending everyday life with existential depth, leaves a lasting legacy of humanism and lyrical insight.

title: Ashes 2025: 'Five or six days of drinking' ‚Äî England players' behaviour set for review
content: England's cricket board will investigate claims of excessive player drinking during a mid-Ashes break in Noosa, Queensland. Managing director Rob Key stated that while he supports players switching off, heavy drinking is unacceptable.  He confirmed the matter would be looked into if reports of prolonged alcohol consumption prove accurate, emphasizing the need for professionalism.

title: Akhlaq lynching case: Court rejects UP govt plea to withdraw charges against accused
content: A court in Gautam Buddha Nagar has dismissed the Uttar Pradesh government's plea to withdraw prosecution in the Akhlaq lynching case. The judge's decision was lauded by Akhlaq's lawyer, who stated that justice has been served to the family. The next hearing is scheduled for January 6th.

title: Matt Chapman & Taylor Chapman net worth 2025: MLB earnings and family wealth
content: San Francisco Giants' third baseman Matt Chapman is projected to earn approximately $26 million in salary in 2025, contributing to an estimated net worth of $53 million. While his wife, Taylor, is involved in fitness, her financial details are not publicly available, making Matt's earnings the primary driver of the family's financial picture.

title: US embassy, consulates in India to stay closed over Christmas period; routine services suspended
content: The US embassy in India will be closed from December 24 to December 26 due to a Presidential Executive Order mandating federal government closures. Routine consular services will be suspended, with only emergency assistance available for US citizens. Normal operations are set to resume on December 29.

title: 'Demands from everywhere': Vadra on Cong leader's Priyanka for PM pitch
content: Robert Vadra backed Congress MP Imran Masood‚Äôs push for Priyanka Gandhi as a potential PM face, saying there are demands from everywhere for her, and even for his own entry into politics, while stressing focus on real issues. Priyanka had flagged rising attacks on minorities in Bangladesh, where a Hindu youth‚Äôs lynching led to arrests and strong condemnation.

title: OTD: How Boycott overtook Sobers; became Test cricket's top run-scorer
content: On this day in 1981, England's Geoffrey Boycott shattered Garry Sobers' long-standing Test run-scoring record in Delhi. Needing 82, Boycott achieved his 22nd century, reaching 8,037 runs. This milestone marked a significant moment before his subsequent, abrupt retirement from the game.

title: Jaxson Dart‚Äôs lucky diamond necklace breaks during 13‚Äì16 loss to Vikings
content: New York Giants quarterback Jaxson Dart's cherished heart-studded diamond necklace, a symbol of his sister and spreading love, broke during a recent game. This sentimental good-luck charm, worn since college and surviving many hits, was lost mid-game, prompting commentary on its significance. Dart previously shared its deep personal value, emphasizing meaningful connections over material possessions.

title: 'I ran to save my life': UK-based singer Charles Antony recalls chaos at Messi event in Kolkata
content: London-based singer Charles Antony described his harrowing experience at Lionel Messi's G.O.A.T Tour event in Kolkata, where chaos erupted and he feared for his life. Antony, who had composed a special song for Messi, was forced to flee amid a stampede of angry fans unable to see the football star.

title: NMC invites applications for new medical colleges and MBBS seat expansion for 2026-27
content: The National Medical Commission has opened online applications for new MBBS colleges and increased UG seat intake for the 2026-27 academic year. The application window is from December 29, 2025, to January 28, 2026. Revised fees and substantial bank guarantees are now required, with a temporary relaxation on the seat cap.

title: Not just Call of Duty: How Vince Zampella changed first-person shooter video games
content: Zampella‚Äôs defining contribution was not graphical fidelity or technical ambition. It was mood. He understood that tension lives in restraint, that immersion deepens when players hesitate, and that fear is most effective when it feels earned rather than theatrical.

title: Strict action for New Year violations; special drunk driving checks from Wednesday
content: Hyderabad CP says riders/motorists caught drunk will face vehicle seizure, a fine of ‚Çπ10,000, six-month jail term and even permanent cancellation of driving licences

content: KPCC general secretary and two-time Corporation councillor questions selection process, alleges norms were bypassed as District Congress Committee announced candidates for split terms

title: J&K HC dismisses Mehbooba‚Äôs PIL on undertrials; says courts cannot serve as forums for electoral campaigns
content: The court said that the PIL was grounded in ambiguity and rested on incomplete, vague and unsubstantiated assertions. The jurisdiction of PIL could not be invoked based on generalised claims without naming affected persons, challenging specific orders or placing verifiable material on record

content: An official spokesman said the Commission has ‚Äúalready collected and examined the written proceedings and statements submitted earlier as part of the preliminary process‚Äù

content: The release added that genuine voters can still be added back in electoral roll during the Claims and Objections phase

title: 95 lakh names deleted from rolls of three States, one UT
content: The voters whose names have been deleted can apply for re-inclusion. The electoral officers will take a final decision on the applications, and the final rolls will be issued on February 14

title: 22 CPI (Maoist) cadres surrender in Odisha
content: They carried collective bounty of ‚Çπ1.84 crore on their heads; Odisha Police say they will be given subsidised housing, health plans and other welfare provisions to facilitate their mainstreaming

title: BJP cries foul as police quell violence at Bangladeshi mission in Kolkata
content: Suvendu Adhikari said police violence proved that there is no difference between Mamata Banerjee‚Äôs government in Bengal and Mohammad Yunus‚Äôs government in Bangladesh

title: West Bengal govt. suppressing peaceful protests over violence against Hindus in Bangladesh: BJP
content: The attacks on the community in Bangladesh had deeply hurt and angered Hindus in India, prompting peaceful demonstrations in various parts of the country, BJP MP and spokesperson Sudhanshu Trivedi said

title: Gold price touches ‚Çπ1 lakh per sovereign, buyers feel the pinch
content: With the wedding season in full swing, families planning weddings are left in the lurch as gold jewellery remains an essential prerequisite for most Kerala brides

title: NCP-SP to contest Mumbai polls with MVA, says party
content: For the first time, NCP-SP has spoken about contesting the Mumbai polls as part of the MVA; till now, the Shiv Sena, NCP-SP, and Congress have been exploring other arrangements for the polls

title: Trade unions call for strike against new Labour Codes, rural work law on February 12
content: Ten CTUs, alleged that the changes in the laws are a multi-pronged attack on people‚Äôs rights; a national convention of workers, scheduled on January 9, will formally ratify the call to strike

title: India‚Äôs first anti-terror policy to be released soon
content: Digital radicalisation, the misuse of open borders, and conversion networks funded by foreign players are among the key issues being discussed in the run-up to the policy‚Äôs release

title: App that helps travellers locate nearby toilets launched in Kerala
content: The¬†‚ÄòTake a Break‚Äô¬†project launched through local bodies to address shortage of public toilets, particularly for women¬†travellers

title: Five Pakistani police personnel killed in bombing, shooting attack
content: The Pakistani Taliban, known as Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP), an Islamist militant group, later claimed responsibility ‚Äãfor the attack

title: A.P. government aiming at welfare schemes that lead to jobs, livelihoods: Kolusu
content: The government is also planning to hold a skill census to identify the skill gaps and accordingly provide necessary training for the State‚Äôs youth, says Minister

title: DMK has strength, ideology, and resolve to oppose authoritarian forces, says Stalin
content: At a Christmas event organised by the¬†DMK¬†in¬†Perambur, the Chief Minister says the minority communities in the country are living in a sense of fear. He also lists the initiatives taken by his government for their welfare

title: Russian strike could collapse Chernobyl shelter: plant director
content: Kyiv has accused Russia of repeatedly targeting the facility, the site of a 1986 meltdown that is still the world‚Äôs worst ever nuclear disaster, since Moscow invaded in February 2022

title: Libya's Army Chief Killed In Plane Crash In Turkey
content: Libya's prime minister said the chief of staff of the country's army was killed in an airplane accident in Turkey on Tuesday after he visited Ankara.

title: "Hope They Will Listen": Pope Leo Calls For Global Truce On Christmas Day
content: Pope Leo XIV on Tuesday called for a global truce on Christmas Day, expressing "great sadness" that "apparently Russia rejected a request" for one.

title: "Will Not Bow Down To Any Pressure": Iran, US Spar Over Nuclear Talks At UN
content: The United States and Iran traded barbs at the United Nations Security Council on Tuesday over conditions for reviving nuclear talks, with the US saying it remains ready for direct negotiations and Iran rejecting Washington's terms.

title: Trump In New Epstein Files: Jet Flights To Mar-a-Lago Subpoena - 5 Takeaways
content: The newest US document dump on Jeffrey Epstein is sprawling, uneven and heavily redacted -- but tucked inside are moments that have sharpened scrutiny on President Donald Trump's long-acknowledged past association with the notorious sex offender.

title: Shehbaz Sharif's Dialogue Offer To Imran Khan's Party To Ease Tensions
content: Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif on Tuesday offered talks to the opposition Pakistan Tehreek-i-Insaf to ease political tension in the country, days after the party founder Imran Khan and his wife Bushra Bibi were sentenced to 17 years in jail each.

title: Court Rejects Plea To Drop Mehul Choksi's Fugitive Economic Offender Tag
content: A court here has rejected Mehul Choksi's application seeking to quash the proceedings to declare him a Fugitive Economic Offender' (FEO) in the Punjab National Bank (PNB) fraud case.

title: 'Don't Object To India Action If...' Pak Leader Slams Own Country Over Kabul
content: A Pakistani lawmaker has called out the hypocrisy of his country's leadership, drawing a parallel between Islamabad's military actions against Kabul and India's 'Operation Sindoor'.

title: "People Are Angry": Trump Says Epstein Files Are 'Ruining Reputations'
content: Donald Trump said he believed "people are very angry that pictures are being released" that connect them to notorious sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, days after the Justice Department released a new tranche of files tied to the late financier.

title: "Ask Rekha Gupta": AAP On Lt Governor's Pollution Letter To Arvind Kejriwal
content: As Delhi struggles with air pollution, a fresh political battle erupted on Tuesday after Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena sent a sharply worded letter to former Chief Minister and Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) chief Arvind Kejriwal.

title: Woman's Body Found Wrapped In Plastic Bags, Blanket In Jaipur
content: The body of an unidentified woman was found stuffed in plastic sacks on the porch of a house in the Shastri Nagar area here on Tuesday morning, police said, adding that injury marks on her face pointed to murder.

title: Duty-Free Access, $20-Billion Investment: Inside India-New Zealand Trade Deal
content: India and New Zealand concluded a landmark Free Trade Agreement (FTA) on Monday, aimed at boosting trade, investment, and mobility between the two nations. Negotiations for this had begun in March this year.

title: Assam Man Arrested For Social Media Post Supporting Bangladesh Lynching
content: A man was arrested in Assam's Kamrup district on Tuesday for allegedly making a social media post in support of the lynching of a Hindu youth in Bangladesh, police said.

title: Assam Will Be Part Of Bangladesh If Immigrants Rise By 10%: Himanta Sarma
content: Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Tuesday claimed that Assam will "automatically be included" in Bangladesh if the number of people from the neighbouring country residing in the northeastern state increased by another 10 per cent.

title: UP Man Posts Dead Wife's Photo On WhatsApp Status, Then Dies By Suicide
content: A 27-year-old man hanged himself in a hotel room here after putting up a WhatsApp status with a photograph of his first wife, police said on Tuesday.

title: Accused Of Molestation, Foreign Student Falls From 4th Floor In Chhattisgarh
content: A Liberian national studying MBA in Chhattisgarh died under suspicious circumstances after allegedly falling off a residential building in Nava Raipur Atal Nagar.

title: How A Routine Timber Bust Exposed A Massive Terror-Funding Network
content: What began as a routine case of illegal timber smuggling in the tribal heartland of Madhya Pradesh has now exploded into a multi-agency national security investigation, raising chilling questions.

title: On Aravalli Row, Environment Minister's Conservation Assurance To NDTV
content: Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav, facing questions on the Aravallis, mounted a strong defence of the Centre on Tuesday, alleging that the controversy is being driven by misinformation and political motives rather than a concern for conservation.

title: Don't Want Bitter Ties With Big Neighbour Like India: Bangladesh Leader
content: Bangladesh's Finance Advisor Dr Salehuddin Ahmed said on Tuesday that the interim government does not want a "bitter relationship with a big neighbour like India", and that they are aiming to develop bilateral relations.

title: 42.74 Lakh Names Dropped In Madhya Pradesh Draft Voter Rolls After SIR
content: The draft electoral roll prepared after the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) exercise in Madhya Pradesh was released by the Election Commission of India on Tuesday, following a meeting with political parties.

title: Nepal woman recovering after heart transplant at Ernakulam GH
content: By performing its first-ever heart transplant, Ernakulam GH became the first district hospital in the government sector in the country to carry out the surgery, says the  authorities

title: Work to widen road atop Jawadhu Hills in Tiruvannamalai begins
content: Blinkers and LED streetlights will be avoided in the stretch to allow free movement of wild animals in the hills during night

title: Councillor, two others, booked for assaulting autorickshaw drivers in Vellore
content: Initial inquiry revealed that separate autorickshaw stands affiliated to the DMK and the VCK have been operating near the new bus terminus, off Chennai - Bengaluru Highway Road (NH48) near Katpadi bridge for the past few years

title: 42.7 lakh voters deleted from Madhya Pradesh draft roll after SIR
content: Of the 42.74 lakh, 8.46 lakh are dead, 31.51 lakh were absent or had migrated, and 2.77 lakh people were registered as voters in more than one place, the Election Commission said

title: Film chamber to stop distributing movies in theatres under KSFDC from January
content: The apex body of film organisations in the Malayalam film industry had earlier deferred its strike, announced from June 1, 2025, following an assurance from Minister for Culture Saji Cherian that the government would consider its demands

title: Low temperature and frost lead to loss for tea sector in Munnar
content: A large quantity of tea leaves have wilted owing to the frost. Once it melts, tender leaf buds dry up under the sun. Plucking then cannot be resumed for another three months, leading to substantial loss

title: Nitin Nabin calls Rahul Gandhi a part-time politician
content: After Bihar, the BJP will win West Bengal and Kerala as well, the newly elected party president said, adding that the BJP is a party in which any worker who works with honesty and determination could reach the top

title: Congress picks V.K. Minimol, Shiny Mathew for split mayoral term in Kochi Corpn.
content: The decision came as a major setback to two-time councillor and KPCC general secretary Deepthy Mary Varghese, who had been widely considered the frontrunner for Mayor‚Äôs post;¬†Deputy Mayor‚Äôs post to be shared between Deepak Joy and K.V.P. Krishnakumar

title: Court awards life term for 13 in lynching of father-son duo in Murshidabad
content: On April 12, Harogobind Das and Chandan Das were hacked to death after being dragged out of their home at Jafrabad village in West Bengal when a protest against the Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025 turned violent

title: Teachers, students under pressure due to new norms, say Navyaandhra association leaders
content: Frequent examinations have turned the process into a chaotic exercise creating undue pressure and also resulting in students developing a fear for exams, they claim

title: Rahul Gandhi‚Äôs leadership now being questioned within Congress and among allies: BJP
content: BJP spokesperson alleges Mr. Gandhi is making ‚Äúanti-national‚Äù remarks abroad because he has nost the support of Congress insiders, allies from the CPI(M), NCP(SP), DMK, SP, TMC, and NC

title: Govt. to go in appeal against trial court verdict in actor rape case
content: Government has given its nod to file an appeal against the trial court judgment before Kerala High Court when the court reopens after Christmas vacation

title: Naidu unveils South India Rocketry Challenge‚Äì2026 poster
content: The initiative aimed at nurturing rocket-making skills among school and college students across the region

title: Centre asks States to hold special gram sabhas for awareness on VB-G RAM G
content: In letter to States and Union Territories, the Centre has asked that these meetings be held by December 26 with the active participation of workers, women, SC/ST households, and vulnerable groups

title: Nothing special about DCM‚Äôs Delhi visit, says Satish Jarkiholi
content: The Minister says he hopes the party high command will end the confusion about the change of leadership in the State

title: PODA piloted by Kerala Police focuses on corporate-led drug prevention
content: Survey reveals very high drug consumption among financially stable youth in the age group of 25-35 in Kerala

title: Telangana conducts first State-level mock exercise on floods and industrial disasters
content: Large-scale exercise organised in response to climate-related challenges, including sudden heavy rainfall and flash floods, as well as a series of industrial accidents in recent years

title: Entries open for The Hindu¬†Margazhi¬†Music Contest
content: To enter¬†the contest,¬†participants¬†should¬†submit¬†a video of¬†their performance at¬†https://newsth.live/margazhi2025¬†or scan the QR code

title: Six arrested for honour killing; protests staged in Hubballi, Kalaburagi
content: The Dharwad District Police are making efforts to trace the remaining nine accused in the case, while nine victims are recovering in hospital

title: TGSRTC connects city suburbs, mofussil areas with IT Corridor
content: New routes designed to reduce travel time and improve last-mile connectivity, according to TGSRTC Hyderabad Region Manager Sudha Parimala

title: Close to two lakh entries under ASD list in Kozhikode‚Äôs draft electoral roll
content: As many as 26,58,847 enumeration forms were distributed in the district as part of the SIR; a total of 1,86,179 voters were found to be dead, untraceable/absent, permanently shifted, or having duplicate names

title: Irinjalakuda to host Varnakkuda cultural festival from December 26
content: The maiden Innocent memorial award to be presented to actor Tovino Thomas; P. Jayachandran memorial award for singer Harishankar; writer Anand to receive people‚Äôs tribute

title: Andhra Pradesh targets pothole-free roads by January-end: Minister
content: ‚Çπ3,000 crore sanctioned for repair and development of over 10,000 km of roads; two-wheelers, autos and tractors to be exempt from proposed tolls, he says

title: Over 24 lakh voters out of draft electoral roll in Kerala after SIR
content: In all, 24,08,503 voters are in the Absent, Shifted, Dead (ASD) list published alongside the draft rolls. Of this, 6,45,548 are listed as ‚Äòuntraceable/absent,‚Äô ¬†8,16,221 as ‚Äòpermanently shifted,‚Äô while 1,60,830, are in the ‚Äòothers‚Äô category.

title: Sabarimala gold theft: Bellary-based jeweller moves Kerala HC seeking bail
content: He is charged with misappropriating 474 gm of gold from the gold-plated copper coverings of the Dwarapalaka idols

title: Chairperson‚Äôs post to be shared in Maradu municipality
content: Ajitha Nandakumar and Suneela Sibi will serve as chairperson in turns, each for two and a half years, while Congress councillors Jinson Peter and P.P. Santhosh will share the vice chairperson post for a specified period

title: LeBron vs. Dillon Brooks: 'Social media junkie' to 'Help the bear' and everything between
content: the los Angeles lakers and Phoenix Suns have split two matchups this season . the two have had their fair share of battles on the court, but all comes down to competition . leBron James and Dillon Brooks will meet again on tuesday in Phoenix .

title: Transfer portal: Tracking who intends to move
content: College football's transfer portal officially opens at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. Once the portal opens, players have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: From Lane Kiffin to Pat Fitzgerald, we rank every FBS coaching hire
content: former Nebraska quarterback Scott Frost returned to Lincoln to save a flailing cornhuskers program . he went 16-31 and was fired early in his fifth season . former Ohio State player and longtime Buckeyes assistant Luke Fickell took the Wisconsin head coaching job .

title: Purdy and RB Christian McCaffrey help lead 49ers past Colts

title: H-1B visa: DHS replaces random lottery selection, priority now to those earning higher wages
content: Lubna Kably is a senior editor, who focuses on various policies and legislation. In particular, she writes extensively on immigration and tax policies. The Indian diaspora is the largest in the world; through her articles she demystifies the immigration-policy related developments in select countries for outbound students, job aspirants and employees. She also analyses the impact of Income-tax and GST related developments for individuals and business entities. title: NFL playoff-clinching scenarios: What's at stake for nine teams in Week 17?
content: eight more teams punched their ticket into the postseason during week 16 of 2025 . 10 of 14 teams have qualified for the playoffs with two weeks to go . five AFC teams and four NFC teams have a chance to secure something this week .

title: 2026 NFL Pro Bowl AFC, NFC rosters: The league's top players
content: the rosters are set for the 2026 NFL Pro Bowl Games . the Baltimore Ravens, Denver Broncos , San Francisco 49ers and Seattle Seahawks lead the way with each having six players chosen . this year's games include a skills competition and a 7-on-7 flag football game scheduled for Feb. 3 .

title: Wait, no Jordan Love? The biggest Pro Bowl snubs for the AFC and NFC rosters
content: there are always a few standout players who should make the Pro Bowl . the snubs aren't named to the initial AFC and NFC rosters . a handful of players may be disappointed to not make the AFC or NFC teams .

title: What has gone wrong for four teams trying to make the playoffs?
content: the Lions, Chargers and Bills all clinched with the Colts' loss . we entered the slate with two guaranteed playoff teams, and we leave it with 10 . this column comes to you every Tuesday, though, as we reset our content .

title: Browns won't activate QB Watson from PUP list
content: quarterback Deshaun Watson tore his Achilles tendon in October 2024 . he underwent a second surgery in January after retearing it . the deadline to activate Watson from the PUP list was Tuesday, when the practice window closed .

title: The 25 most college football moments of the 21st century
content: college football slips so easily into pure chaos after all the on-field heroics . college football is a celebration not of the sublime but of the ridiculous . it has to be a little bit weird, colorless, color-coded moment .
